solution_line_template: Her errands include a {commute_time} min commute and {grocery_time} min grocery shopping, {dry_cleaning_time} min for dry cleaning and {dog_pickup_time} min to grab the dog for a total of {commute_time}+{grocery_time}+{dry_cleaning_time}+{dog_pickup_time} = <<{commute_time}+{grocery_time}+{dry_cleaning_time}+{dog_pickup_time}={total_errand_time}>>{total_errand_time} minutes

Her errands took {total_errand_time} minutes and she has another {cooking_time} minutes of cooking for a total of {total_errand_time}+{cooking_time} = <<{total_errand_time}+{cooking_time}={total_chore_time_minutes}>>{total_chore_time_minutes} minutes of chores/errands

{minutes_per_hour} minutes are in 1 hour and she has {total_chore_time_minutes} minutes of work so that's {total_chore_time_minutes}/{minutes_per_hour} = <<{total_chore_time_minutes}/{minutes_per_hour}={total_chore_time_hours}>>{total_chore_time_hours} hours
She is off of work at {work_off_hour}:00 pm and has {total_chore_time_hours} hours of errands/chores so she won't be able to eat until {work_off_hour}+{total_chore_time_hours} = {dinner_hour}:00 pm
